text: Draft at Armsby Abbey. Pours cloudy and yellow with a big white head. Leaves a shitload of lacing in the glass. Nice floral and grassy notes on the nose. Grassy and piney on the tongue. Finished clean. Very quaffable and approachable.

On tap at BGH. Pours a cloudy gold. Fruit and hops on the nose. Hoppy and slightly bitter. Flavors somewhat muddled. Good. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Draft. Cloudy yellow body with a frothy white head, slowly diminishing. Aroma of citrus, toasted grain, lemon, orange, light grapefruit. The flavor is moderately sweet and lightly bitter. It finishes lightly to moderately sweet and lightly to moderately bitter. Medium body, watery texture, lively carbonation. Really nice balance among flavorful citrusy hops (orange, citrus, peach), bittering hops and sweet malts resulting in a highly quaffable beer. Not a lot of depth, but whats there is really tasty.

Pours a hazy bright yellow with white head. A strong floral, citrus, hop and pine aroma. A sweet citrus taste with pine, tropical fruit, floral and hops. A sweet citrus and light bitter hoo aftertaste - but not overwhelming.

Thanks Adam! This stuff us 2legit2quit. Ha. Anyway.... Pours a light sunny yellow. Hazy with bubbly white head. Beautiful bubblegum and mango aromas. Tastes like it smells. Reminds me of Edward with a great bitter finish. Fuck. Its enough to make me want to move to Vermont....Trump and Clinton be damned.
Tap. Milky hazy rust marigold. Tropical hops, melon, sum hay, and zesty citrus aromas. Melon rind, grapefruit, guava, slight wood and a juicy finish. Medium slick soft body.

Draft pour at the source. The beer is a hazy yellow with a big white head of foam. The aroma has juicy, earthy, citrusy notes. Very bright. Medium bitterness and a juicy sweetness comes through. Medium body and medium carbonation. Spritzy mouthfeel.

750ml growler pour at Hill Farmstead. Pours slightly hazy, golden yellow. Natural citrus flavor, bitter hop finish. Not too overwhelming. Goes down easy and very enjoyable. In terms of IPAs, one of the best out there.

From notes. Had this one at Dougs house for a celebration of his birthday on May 14. 750 mL flip-top. Hmm. Didnt realize this was the Grassroots label. The pour is a hazy straw yellow color with a large white head that falls to a film, leaving a good bit of lace behind. The aroma is interesting. There is a very floral hop to it, with a light tropical fruit. There is a slight grassiness and a light malt backbone. Its pretty good. The flavor is very similar. There is a strong floral hop and grassiness to it with a light maltiness and a decent tropical fruit addition. The mouth feel is a little heavy for an IPA and the carbonation doesnt help. The aftertaste is grassy and floral with a light fruitiness and malt finish. Not my favorite Hill Farmstead IPA, but its a good brew.

Growler from brewery. Pours slightly hazy straw with some frothy head and lots of clumpy lacing. Nose is floral and juicy citrus. Taste of bright citrus, grapefruit, some lemon. Taste medium bitter, light/medium sweet. Full sticky body with lively carbonation and lasting bitterness. So nice.

UPDATED: JUN 29, 2016 Tap at Hops Hill, Brooklyn. Pours hazy pale yellow, big fluffy white head. Aroma is tangerine, peach, mango, really bright and aromatic citrus notes, pine, floral notes, lemon, orange. Some mild dank notes as it warms and bit of grass. Flavor is pine, peach, orange rind (that?s prominent), floral, lemon. Really nice. Bitter piney finish. Pleasant mouthfeel, nice effervescence, I wouldn?t mind less (ala Maine Beer Co style light carbonation) but still quite nice.

750ml growler. Hazy golden yellow with a frothy white head. Flavors are sweet cereals, grapefruit, melon, lime zest and garlic with dank and grassy notes. Medium body, moderate carbonation, smooth texture.

Lemon citrusy hoppy aroma with a grapefruit almost sour aroma. Very nice. Taste adds in a resinous piney hop which goes all the way to the finish. Balanced nice ipa, piney dominates the hop profile though. Light palate, strong piney hops but still easy drinking. Well made ipa, would like less piney but so well made I cant knock the rating much due to that. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Draught @ Blind Tiger Alehouse. Hazy pale yellow with creamy white head, citrus aroma, medium carbonation, bitter citrus peel taste, thin body, long bitter citrus peel finish. Very citrusy IPA.

Mekelburg,s, Brooklyn tap: pours hazy orange yellow with a white head. Aroma is lemony citrus, biscuit, other tropical fruits, and maybe a hint of flowers. Taste is not very bitter. Does not seem like a really hefty IPA. Nice dry fruitiness. Nice light finish. Pretty splendid.

Pas ma préférée de Shaun Hill. On remarque dentrée de jeu une belle couleur jaune vivante, qui la diffère des grandes IPA vermontoise tirant plus sur le orangé. En bouche, cest assez amer, cest assez citronnée. Cest assez mince comme liquide, ça manque de profondeur. Content de lavoir essayer, mais cest pas le genre de liquide que je reprendrai un growler lors de mes prochaines visites à Greensboro.

10 oz. draft at RR. Pours cloudy with moderate foam that leaves nice lace. Aroma is lime rind, pale malt, and mild biscuits. Taste is similar with a nice mouth feel, and bergamot finish. One elegant beer.

On tap at blue dog waiting for PtY. Cloudy pale yellow pour with a white head. Aromas of light citrus fruits, tangerine, slight pineapple, lemon. Taste is medium light bitterness. Soft mouthfeel. Goes down real easy. Not super juicy like some of those other NE hoppy beers but still awesome.

July 16, 2015. On tap at Hill Farmstead and a growler for breakfast the day after.
Cloudy yellow with a large white head. Aroma is fruity with pineapple, orange, lemon zest, hints of papaya, grass and light biscuit notes. Taste is light to medium sweet, fruity, soft grassy bitterness. Finish is light fruity sweetness with pineapple, papaya, some juicy orange notes, hints of biscuit, medium grassy bitterness, light crisp mineral notes. Medium bodied, soft to average carbonation, rounded texture with a light crisp note. 
Great!

Backlog 150806
Quite light coloured, nice head. Loads of hops and yeast to it. Light tartness and grapefruit to it. O: Nice.
Tap at Jeffrey. Light banana colored beer. Nose piney and herbal. Tastes of pine cones, lots of pear, herbal, peach, and yeast and malt. Bitter and lasting finish. Interesting.

Tap on 12/22/15. Pours a hazy dark straw. Fluffy white head. Nose is citrusy hops, grapefruit, juice. Taste is the same and grass, white pepper. Dry and yummy. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Growler from the brewery, shared at the 10th Annual Epic & Unusual Beer Tasting, 11/29/15. Hazy orange, large foamy off-white head, decent retention. Aroma of herbal, piney, mango, grapefruit hops ,pale malt. The taste is piney, tropical hops, fresh grapefruit, pale malt. Medium bodied, well balanced.

On tap at Hill Farmstead. An unclear pale yellow colored beer with a finger-thick white head. Lacings. The aroma is piney and grapefruity, with some citrus peel and pineapple. Its dry, bitter and soft on the palate, with flavors of pine cones and grapefruit dominating. Not much malts to be detected. Lasting finish with pine cones and grapefruit. An easy drinkable and quenching beer. 150610

Tap. Blackback Pub, Waterbury, VT. Hazy, dark straw colour. Thin, lasting, white head. Sweet malts. Strawberry and mango hop. Sweet, white pear. Taste is soft, earthy bitter. Soft mouthfeel. Finishes stone fruit, earthy bitter.

Draft at Prohibition Pig. Pours a slightly hazy light orange yellow color with an off white head. Aroma is tropical fruits, touch of malty sweetness. Flavor is a bit more mellow than most HF stuff. Still solid though.

Pours murky yellow with low white head. Aroma of citrus, mango, passion fruit, pine, the entire fruit bowl... Yum! Taste is mellow fruit sweet with a gentle bitterness present through to the finish. Incredibly smooth and balanced. Body is light and smooth with soft carbonation. These guys certainly know their shit!

750 mL growler. Originally reviewed 6/17/2013.

Hazy pale orange. Small white head. Doesnt retain very well. Wispy surface.

Nose is very grassy and herbal. Slight sweetness.

Taste is grapefruit hop. Sweetness kicks in. The herbal and grassy notes hold off until the finish. Moderate bitterness in the finish.

 Medium body. Sweetness keeps it from being light. Medium bitterness and medium low carbonation. 

 Pretty good, but one dimensional. Very clean, but Id go for a different hop profile.

Draft @ The Pony Bar - 1st Ave, New York. Pours a hazy golden color with a small white head. Has a fruity grapefruit hoppy piney aroma. Fruity malty grapefruit hoppy bitter flavor. Has a fruity malty grapefruit hoppy bitter finish.

Very hazy gold ale pour with a big fluffy white head. Dank notes with tropical fruits, pine, earth, and a bit of caramel. Big, bitter, long finish. A bit too big and bitter for me but a damn fine example of that style of brew.
Hazy gold pour, white head. Vaguely sweet aroma of hay, super bitter flavor, Grassy and floral, with a big malty backbone. Tongue strippingly bitter. Did not live up to expextations but still good.
On tap at Blue Dog. Poured a golden color with a small sized head. Citrus, pine and some earthiness with a touch of caramel.
Huge pine, dank/resin, lemon, grass, floral, light apricot/nectarine, crackery sweetness, raw graininess. Long bitter/fruity finish. Balance is amazing, creamy/oaty mouthfeel.

On tap at Prohibition Pig brewpub, Waterbury, Vermont.
This was poured into a half pint glass, the brewpub normally pours it in.
The appearance was a hazy blurry yellow color with a slim white little head that dissipated and left no lacing.
The smell started off with a sweet citrus and sweet grassy blend leading into subtle crisp tropical fruits and underscored by just a little bit of bitter pine.
The taste had a moderate amount of sweetness with some light bitterness of the pine carrying itself back into the balance of it all. A light citrus aftertaste runs into the finish.
On the palate, this one sat about a light on the body with a nice sessionable crispness carrying itself along my tongue.
Overall, this was a very nice AIPA that I would have again.
Golden with white head. Aroma of grassy and floral hops. Medium body, lightly carbonated. Floral and lightly piney hop flavor, off-dry, crisp refreshing finish, good balance. Very nice.

2015-09-23 En fût @ Hill Farmstead. Bière dorée avec un léger collet qui colle aux parois du verre. Au nez, agrumes et pamplemousses juteux avec des notes florales. En bouche, houblons fruités et floraux sur une base maltée et bien croquante. Finale amère avec une pointe acidulée. Un autre petit bijoux de la part de cette brasserie! 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Golden pour, white head. Nose is earthy, floral, lemon, well water. Taste is juicy hops, some lemon, more citrus fruits, earthy, floral. Lingering bittering hops on the finish.

Growler from the brewery, pours a hazy gold with some frothy, lacing white head. Nice nose, dank and resinous, pine cones, vegetal, grapefruit, orange, some floral notes. Flavor has some fruit sweetness, Asian pear, light bubblegum, then the hops, pine resin, grass, lemon, grapefruit. Full bodied with pleasing levels of bitterness and sweetness on the end.

Growler. A golden beer with a white head. The aroma has notes of straw, hay, spices, citrus fruits, and hops. The flavor is sweet with notes of citrus fruits, hops, peaches, straw, and malt, leading to a bitter finish.

Tap @ Rattle n Hum: This IPA is AMAZING. Green abounds in aroma and flavor. It tasted super fresh. Complex hops with notes of grass, juniper, floral and a well balanced bitterness. Refreshing beverage.
UPDATED: DEC 3, 2016 Pours a bright but hazy yellow with a white lacing. The aroma is earthy, with mild citrus more malt forward than expected. There are definitely some sour notes

Growler dégusté en compagnie de ma famille chez Paul. Bière pâle, blonde, voilée et mousseuse qui colle au verre comme toutes les bières de cette formidable brasserie. Beaucoup de houblons verts au nez, dagrumes telles la papaye et lorange. En bouche, jai trouvé les saveurs inégales et malheureusement pas à la hauteur des arômes que jai humé si avidement. Amertume sèche à mi palais malgré un corps dune onctuosité remarquable. Les saveurs rappellent encore une fois les agrumes mais sans être véritablement affirmées. Le bouquet ma paru un peu mou et sans identité. Bien que bien faite, cette bière ne ma pas enchanté.

Bottle at a tasting at home. A bit hazy pale golden beer with an offwhite head. Hoppy citrus sourish fruity aroma. Hoppy citrus fruity grassy sourish refreshing flavour. Really a lovely refreshing beer :-)
Growler. Pours pale yellow with a thin white head. Aroma of passion, pineapple, hop. Skunk, clean. Taste is skunk, tropicl, very smooth bitter and dry, exotic. Dope shit

750ml bottle bought today @ Hill Farmstead. Aroma: loads of citrus, grapefruits, pines and some floral notes. App: hazy straw, white ring in the middle of the glass and all around it lacing a nice lacing. Taste and palate: medium body, resinous but soft texture on the palate, soft carbonation, crisp dry bitter finish. Overall: this is good. This is really good. It literally pets my palate. What a great pleasure to drink this. A great offering from HF. Glad I drank it fresh like that.

Pours a pale yellow with a thin white head. Nose is sweetish and fruity. Taste is somewhat sweet, with a nice citrus hop bite. Very pleasant brew.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Growler received in trade. Pours hazy pale golden with a frothy white head that leaves some thin lacing on the glass while dissipating. Smell is fruity and tiny grassy with crackers, freshly baked white bread, pink grapefruit juice, mango, pineapple, papaya, freshly cut grass, pine needles, lemon zest and hints of minerals. Taste is tiny sweet, bitter, fruity and slightly grassy. Mouthfeel is slightly round, slightly round, slightly astringent and medium bodied. Finish is tiny sweet and bitter with white bread, grapefruit juice, mango, papaya, star fruit, freshly cut grass, pine needles, orange zest and lemon zest. Just great! Bitterness, fruitiness and grassiness in perfect balance. Yum!

(Bottle) Pours hazy yellow with a white head. The aroma holds tropical fruits, citrus and some pine. Tight, cracker-like malt profile. The flavour is light sweet to dry, medium to heavily bitter and light acidic. Citric, piny, woodsy and light fruity. Pale malt. The mouthfeel is slim and clean with a medium carbonation. Light to medium carbonation.

Draught at Sommarprovning 2015-08-05. Hazy pale golden/yellow beer with a nice offwhite head. Hoppy citrus flavor, pine apples, grapes, lemons, some peach. Hoppy citrus flavor, pine apples, mango, peach, pine, floral notes, grassy, oranges, some grape fruit. Fresh and drinkable.

Growler. Pours cloudy golden with a small off white head. Aroma is citric pink grapefruit some tropical fruits. Flavor is clean fruity citric bitter grapefruit grassy. Good longlived bitter dry finish.

Draught at Three Penny, 7/24/15Lightly-to-moderately hazy golden-brass body is topped by a medium-sized white head showing strong retention.Simcoe has to be one of the most amazing dry hops....no garlic, onion, cat pee issues with it and when its used in a dry/late-hop capacity, you dont get the heavy pine/resin that is associated with boiling it for too long. Instead, juicy red grapefruit, tangy pine, sweet mango and light wintergreen surge forth. Theres a lot more leafy, lush, rather spicy floral notes here, which are well-appreciated and highly enjoyable. The pale malts, well-attenuated, provide soft, unobtrusive balance in the background. Clean yeast character, flawless and with no resin problems or alcohol.The flavor has the creamy texture of the Excursions #4 I just had, but with a tighter carbonation that helps lend crispness to the beer. Light wintergreen, spruce, lime and red grapefruit flit about the palate, while a very gentle maltiness balances just like in the nose. Bitterness builds some towards the finish, but never to the point of fatigue. Extremely drinkable, flavorful and lacking any harsh pine or heavy bitterness. Nothing flashy, and some may not be wowed by its relative tameness, but the execution and elegance here are right up there with the best IPAs Ive ever had.  A real god damned treat!

Fresh growler. Pours a hazy pale orange with a fluffy white head. Aroma is floral, citrus, orange. A wonderful fruity and juicy taste. An initial light apparent sweetness up front; a medium bitterness takes over midpalate. Long, moderately bitter finish. Medium bodied and soft. Wonderful.

[ Bottle ][ 8oz ][ @Tasting ][ $ - ?] [ Tulip ][ 04.07.15 ]murky hay, puffy white head. Simcoe stink hop, light straw with decent tangerine and soft, sugary dough, balanced if straightforward, heavy on paper. Soft profile, light citrus with mango and orange sweetness, dry and nuanced with faint wood. Finish is huge cracker presence, sticky, frothy and full with zesty carb. Really balanced if simplistic but flat body.

Draft at three penny. Pours a hazy pale yellow with a small sudsy white head. Aromas burst out with citrus and pine. Little dank. Flavor of grapefruit, lemon, pine. Light body with a sticky texture. Average carbonation and subtly dry to finish. Super crushable. Awesome.

Draft @ Three Penny Taproom. Bright yellow color. Awesome aroma of pine, bright citrus and grain. Flavor is mostly the same with the simcoe giving that West Coast feel. The hops are jumping in this brew; starts with a huge citrus punch with the grain body giving some balance. The pine shines through in the finish with being abrasive. Damn, this is crushable beyond a reasonable doubt. If I could.buy enough of this it would be a all summer long drinker.
Growler courtesy of dickinsonbeer. Shared with Jredmond. Hazy pale yellow with head. Dank nose. Light prickly palate with slight citrus notes. Solid

Draught @ Hill Farmstead Brewery, Greensboro, VT
Pours hazy yellow with a white head. Aroma has notes of malt, citrus, lime, pine, grape and grass. Taste is medium sweet and medium bitter with a long citrus, grass and piney finish. Body is medium, texture is thin to oily, carbonation is soft.
On tap at the brewery. Really beautiful single IPA with lots of citrus and grass going on. Incredibly drinkable with strong dry hop bite to finish. Yep. Yep yep.
Growler thanks to Russell. Poues a hazy gold with small white head. The aroma is tropical fruit, pine, floral. Medium mouth, pine, floral, juicy, light bitterness, very nice.

UPDATED: AUG 10, 2015 Draft with Paul at black back pub. Pours an ultra hazy orange creme with thick two finger white head. Mouthfeel is medium and bright with notes of dry bitter pine hop, fresh tropical fruits, dry hop profile, wheat, oats, fresh grass and funky simcoe.
Taster and growler from Hill Farmstead. Hazy golden. God, i love simcoe. Dank aroma of juicy tropical fruit and orange juice. Very sweet beer with a sticky resiny hop juice....ohhhhhh cmon.
Growler shared thanks to kermis. Pours cloudy golden. Fruity hoppy nose. grapefruit and citrus. Moderate bitterness. Great stuff.

Growler shared. Pours cloudy golden with a white head. Aroma of tropical fruits, orange, citrus, grapefruit and a little floral note. Flavor is light moderate sweet and over moderate bitter. Super fresh on the palate. Light to medium bodied with light prickly carbonation.

Growler courtesy of and shared with Kermis. Big thanks.
Thick creamy white head. Cloudy blond pour. Lots of citrus bitterness. Lovely

From the source. Golden murky glow in the glass...little lighter than the other ales at HF. Aroma is grapefruit, mangos, and floral hops. Taste is on par with aroma, a little zesty, dry finish. Great beer!

Growler thanks WillRunForBeer. Cloudy gold pour with a small head that fades to a thin ring. Awesome aroma. Juicy oranges and tropical fruit complemented by pine and light flowers. Tastes juicy with some herbs and pine. As usual, awesome moutheel from an HF IPA. Finishes with lingering herbal hops. Pretty awesome.

UPDATED: MAR 28, 2015 Tap at Hill Farmstead. Pours a lightly hazed light gold with a large white head. Aromas of sticky hop cones. Bitter and pretty dry. Nice interplay of pine and flower nectar. Finished dry. Amazing. 
Growler: seemed even better. Adjusting score.
Couleur dorée avec un beau col blanc mousseux. Aromes de fruits tropicaux, résines, herbes. Ce nest pas une IPA hors du commun, mais elle est excellente!
750ml growler. Thanks Dany. Some tart grapefruit. Orange juice pulp. Some bitterness on the finish which is a bit uncommon for HF.

Pours a light golden/straw color from the growler. A slight chill haze, but sparkling carbonation leading to a two finger white head. Aromas are subtle tropical fruit, grass, green onion and light bread. Taste is nice and balanced with some mango notes up front, followed by light citrus zest. Medium bodied soft mouth feel. Another great IPA from Grassroots/HF.

Pours a slightly hazy straw yellow with a huge white frothy head. Nose is strong tropical fruit juice with a nice doughy touch. Lots of citrus. Taste is juicey with bubble gum notes. Lots of floral hops with mango, orange and papaya notes. Some sweetness and breadiness. Beautifully balanced. Low carbonation. Great IPA!
Draft. Pours yellow gold white head. Nose and taste of orange peel, lemon, pine, citrus and caramel malt. Medium body.

Pours a hazy light golden with a medium white head that leaves nice lacing. Nose is of pine, tropical fruits and a little cat piss or maybe onion. Taste is moderately bitter and fruity. Oranges. Not an ounce too sweet. Body is light to medium, carbonation medium. Overall a really nice IPA, a shame that we cant get that in bottles/cans up north!
Draft to stemmed taster at HF. Looks good; a hazy golden orange with white head. Smells and tastes nice, light and juicy with a nice balance of bittersweetness in the background. Delicious!

Growler from the brewery courtesy of my friend Mark. Pours a cloudy pale gold with a moderate, somewhat fluffy, white head that lasted through the first quarter of the glass and left partial lace. Wonderful aroma of fresh pineapple and grapefruit. The flavor is a combination of pineapple, orange and grapefruit fruitiness with a bit of pith. Moderate citrus bitterness at the finish. Medium bodied. Delicious beer!

Growler: Opaque & murky, bright golden-yellow body with a super soapy, bubbly white head; big, voluptuous, billowy. Super juicy aroma of passion fruit, candied peach, melon, pineapple, sweet tangerine, along with a touch of resin, grass, & some faint sugar cookie malt. The flavor is also quite juicy but adds a bit more of a bitter balance. Citrus, tangerine, white pepper coated grapefruit peel, zesty grass, doughy cookies, faint peach... Gets a little more herbal & ashy towards the finish with light pine resins & hop oils coming into play. Dry finish, crisp & sharp. Great IPA.

On tap @ Beachwood Brewing. Hazed golden pour with white foam. Nose is sort of a mix of watermelon, orange, pine, and grapefruit zest. Sort of piney. Flavor is very dry and bitter. Tons of citrus rind, pine, and grapefruit zest. Kind of a lemon and lime thing going on as well. Not much malt character. Very resinous, slightly herbal.

P: Hazy/murky yellow with almost no head. S: Very tropical, loaded with pineapples and mango and light oranges. T: Oranges and pineapples with light citrus. M: Light with soft carbonation and little bitterness. O: Wow, had no idea this one was gonna be this good. A great tropical ipa.
On tap at prohibition p. Whitish golden with lace trail. Good ipa and drinkable.

UPDATED: FEB 3, 2016 Pours hazy glowing golden yellow with half a finger of white head. 
Smell is dank, hops, pine, resin, citrus and orange peel. Taste citrus, mango, grapefruit with bitter floral hops and resin on finish. Citrus bomb and delicious. Silky smooth mouthfeel. Medium body medium carbonation.

Sams bottle share. About as perfect of a beer within a style as you can get. Small snifters. Beautiful clean yellow-gold pour with pillow white head. Some lacing. Aroma of cereal, citrus, hint of pine, brilliant yeasts. The taste was so smooth and good with citrus, hint of floral notes, touch of pine resin, and cereal. Soft texture, but carbonated. Almost like it had a splash of cream in it. Finish is soft and delicate. Fucking good!
Fuck yes. Hazed yellow, puffy white head. So soft and supple. Light earthy hops, some citrusy flavors, grassy hops...yeasty deliciousness. Really really good.

Bu en growler 2 jours après avoir été acheté à Hill Farmstead. Au nez, on a l'impression de sentir une canne de pêche Del Monte avec une petite pointe d'amertume. En bouche, c'est le mariage parfait entre la pêche, l'ananas, l'amertume et melon au miel bien mûr. La finale enveloppe la bouche avec des goûts toujours présents de pêches. Une IPA exceptionnelle qui vaut le détour. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

On tap at the brewery. Milky pale yellow pour with a white head. Tangier than the pale ales with smoother citrus and grapefruit highlights. Good body and mouthfeel. Really smooth. This is one solid IPA. Totally under assuming but delicious and refreshing. Bravo...

Day old growler from the source. Cloudy orange yellow with a clingy white head. Nose is citrus peel, grapefruit pith, grass and honey. Medium body with a refreshing tingle. Taste is pineapple, grass, apple and minerals. Awesome session stuff.

2L growler shared thanks to Lukaduke! Pours opaque pale orange with medium head. Nose is crisp grassy citrus, bitter piney fruit. Taste is crisp grapefruit, grassy pine, citrus zest, soft malt. Finish is dry bitter grassy citrus. Its HF and its hoppy, its great.

UPDATED: APR 18, 2015 Growler from HF - a tip of the hat to Adrian.  Ive had this a couple of times now.   A sharp, grassy, juicy, oily IPA.  It is not heavy, but the flavor is full, and the aroma is lovely.  There is a nice contrast between the nutty, pleasantly bitter taste and the sweet, floral scent.  The head on this is excellent too.  At first I thought it was made with wheat, but it turns out to have some oats in it.  Superb.
Draft at brewery. Another great HF ipa, with light crisp malt and a sort of citrus bouquet, hints of grassy hops. Would love to try a larger, slightly warmer sample. But the foundation is there.

Growler from HF. Pours a hazy yellow straw gold with a large fluffy white head. Aroma of white grapefruit, mango, tangerine and bitter hops. Taste of white grapefruit, tangerine, bitter hops and hints of pineapple and mango. Very nice.

Growler poured into a Hill Farmstead wine stem.

Pour: Body is a mostly hazy, bright mango body. A nice, two fingers of fluffy, sticky white head forms and leaves some nice lacing. 

Smell: Bright, juicy citrus notes explode on the nose. Orange, tangerine, and tangelo. Some pineapple. A nice light raw rolled oats sneaks in the background. Mostly controlled by heavy citrus fruits.

Taste: More of the same from the nose - juicy grapefruit, orange juice, orange zest, and tangerine pulp. A touch of raw doughy sweetness. Lightly acidic from the orange juice. Finishes with a lingering citrus juiciness. 

Mouthfeel: Ridiculously refreshing and bursting with citrus juice. A lightly tingling carbonation mixes well with the acidity from the juice. Finishes with a lingering citrus.

Overall: Another fantastic IPA with citrus juice added from Shaun. Ridiculously drinkable. Light a Society & Solitude #5 light.
750 ml growler thx Heather and Frank A: citrusy, piny, grapefruit. App: hazy pale white head. T/p: thin body with long bitter finish. O: great. Well brewed like any HF offering.

Deux verres de dégustation en attendant de passer au cash. Une IPA pâle sur laquelle trône une mousse blanchâtre qui disparaît bien rapidement. Au nez, que du beau et du bon avec du pamplemousse juteux bien acidulé et des petites fleurs des champs. Sur les papilles, un jeu habille des houblons fruités et floraux avec la présence dune base maltée bien pâle (blé, avoine?) et bien croquante. Cest bon, cest facile à boire et ça fait drôlement sourire. En bouche, le liquide est mince, bien remué par les bulles et plutôt huileux. En finale, cest amer et bien acidulé. Décidément, il est difficile dêtre difficile avec les créations de cette superbe brasserie.

Multiple times.

Looks like a HF IPA. Cloudy straw orange color with a dense, streaky off white head. Juicy grapefruit, orange peel, grassy bitter finish. Like a more citrus forward Edward.

Growler, 04/07/2014. Pours light golden copper, hazy, white head rests thick and foamy on the surface, lots of sticky lacing. Aroma is fizzy orange citrus, floral hops and touch of other white fruits, bed of fresh spruce, subtle earthiness near the end. Taste is melon, peach, sharper citrus and lemon hop character, medium spruce bitterness, grapefruit. Medium body, crazy smooth. Excellent.
Hazy lighter gold colour, loads of lace. Big citrus aroma, peach, grapefruit, pine. Sweetness up front gives away to all of the above mentioned. floral is the adjective Im thinking of. Medium body.

Pour is hazed pale yellow with a tight white head. Nose is mango, citrus, and grapefruit extremely strong. Faint touch of pine and herbal hop. Taste is not as fruity and bright as the nose. Taste has a hint of malt up front, lightly toasted. Hops take over, more grapefruit and less tropical fruit. Light herbal tea hop in back with a moderate bitterness in the finish. Well carbonated and soft body.

My Bottom Line:
Eminent grapefruit and flower petals leap from this IPAs dry and quenching mouthfeel, leading to green bitterness and delicate tartness.

Further Personal Perceptions:
-A sheet of foam settles atop the hazy blond.
-The citrusy fruitiness is also reminiscent of Meyer lemons.
-This is dangerously poundable.
-Pretty much any Hill Farmstead IPA is world-class. You just cant go wrong, just grab one, whatever its called.

Growler.

750 mL growler, huuuuge thanks to Galen and Abi!!! Cloudy lemon colored pour, small frothy white head. Nose and flavor are absolutely divine; notes of pine, white grapefruit pith, and spruce mix with scallion, orange, hints of loamy earth, lemongrass, peach.... just absolute wow. Palate is perfect; frighteningly drinkable, but good body and even a touch of creaminess from the oats. Absolutely outrageous.

On tap at brewery. Light straw wine colour. Aroma, like the flavours - subtle. Floral and mild citrus. Not one of my favourites from Vermont. But on a definite plus side, very session able for the abv.

Taster at the source. Pours light pale yellow gold with a big clingy white head. Aromas of wheat, grass, citrus. Light and easy drinking with orange, grapefruit citrus. A nice oily grapefruit peel hop in the finish.

Chunky growler from
Bowen, many thanks. Had this before but glad to be back in it's good graces and give it a rating. Nose is light lemon citrus kiwi funk, pours almost yellow gold with fluffy white head. Lemon rind and zest in the taste, some little pineapple. More bitter than some other HFS IPAs but still super smooth and balanced all around. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy

Growler shared by Lunch. Thanks Paul!

The beer is hazy and yellow with an inch or more of pure white head. The aroma brings fresh hops, lemons, oranges. Lots of citrus in the flavor. Cracker, malt, biscuit character as well, with some lingering toasted bread in the finish. A tad tart, with a hoppy lemon bitterness. A solid beer and easy to drink, albeit less refined and amazing than my favorite Hill Farmstead IPAs

Bouteille de 750 ml partagée lors dune dégustation Ratebeer Montréal. Arôme: Odeur daiguille de pin avec une pointe dagrume. Apparence: La couleur est blonde légèrement voilée. Présence dun mince col mousseux et dune fine dentelle sur le verre. Saveur: Gout de pin avec une pointe dorange et dananas. Longue durée de larrière goût. Palette: Le corps est moyen avec une texture légèrement onctueuse. Moyenne effervescence en bouche. Présence de pin en arrière goût. (Rating #5411)

750 growler thanks to Chris, thanks man! Pour is a light, slightly hazy Gold with a small white head. Aroma is citrusy, herbal, and grassy with a light sweetness. Flavor is smooth with floral hop and faintly citrus hop dominating. Also a light malty finish with notes of earth and faint yeast. Really easy to drink. Thanks Chris.

From the 12/2013 3R6P gathering +++ Sampled from a growler this beer poured a cloudy pale yellow color with a medium sized foamy white head that left decent lacing. The aroma was strong catbox, tart cactus and perfume. The flavor was bitter and tart with notes of catbox, cactus and perfume. Long finish. Medium body. Meh.

Thick pure gold. Golden kiwi, lemon, and clementine aroma; tons of tropical fruit touched with light herbs and bright bitter touches around the edges. Theres an acidity and faint saltiness to it - almost like lemon juice on sun-dried tomatoes. 

Juicy tangerine, golden kiwi, white grapefruit and pineapple notes; acidic as all hell and wet with the freshest hop oils imaginable. Surprised these arent southern hemisphere hops. Cleanly white bread malts and the smoothness of oats together form a deep and hidden foundation. Light notes of ginger and lemongrass hang out in the cracks.

Brisk but somehow substantial palate. Sunny. Finishes with some dry minerals, some tarragon and apricot skin aftertaste. This one is so light on its feet and whimsical.
growler from Hill Farmstead. another amazing beer from HF. citrusy, orange , lemon rind, pith & zest. Peaches, floral bitterness. Really good

Growler. Thanks Mike. Nose is that perfect soft hop aroma that the best hill beers have. Orange, lemon, berries, melon. Perfect. Flavor is berries and melon, sweet lightly toasted malt. Bitterness is a touch higher than is like but Damn this is great.

Growler poured a hazy apricot with a thin layer of head

Nose and taste was juicy, bitter , citrus. Really solid IPA

Sample from Dedollewaitor, thanks a bunch. Unclear yellow body with a tiny head. Fresh peaches, citrus, grapefruit, hops (simcoe), herbal notes. Soft carbonation. Fruity and bitter flavour. Nice bitter aftertaste. This is great.

Growler. 75cl. Pours hazy yellow with a small creamy head. Nose is hops. Sunny meadows, peach, citrus and red grapefruit. Smooth and juicy. So uffin clean. Bitter crisp finish. Superb again. Blown away even though I expected it to be world class.

Aroma: Citrusy, Garlic, Mild Grapefriit Rinds

Appearance: Hazy Golden Straw Hue, Passes Some Light, Wjite Head, Decent Lacing

Taste: Citrus Rind, Mild Garlic, Mild Oranges

Mouthfeel: Decent Lacing, Medium Bodied, Mildly Drying

Growler at CBC Clerko, muled over by Leighton. It pours hazy pale golden with a medium white head. The nose is juicy, earthy, floral, herbal, grass, spice, pomello and orange. The taste is crisp, earth, toast, grass, grapefruit, spice, orange, pithy, passion fruit, sherbet and candy with a dry finish. Medium body, fine carbonation and velvety mouth-feel. Beautifully balanced. Dry, crisp and crazy drinkable.

Growler de 2L, merci beaucoup à Dany et Marie-France. Arômes explosifs et frais daiguilles de pin et de fruits tropicaux. Robe blonde pâle et trouble, effervescence souple et légère dentelle. En bouche, le houblonnage très aromatique montre un caractère original, portant spécialement sur les conifères et les fruits tropicaux, avec quelques notes dagrumes (lime). La base maltée est svelte mais moelleuse. Finale sèche et relativement peu amère pour le style. Une autre excellente IPA de cette brasserie.

Growler split at CBC, thanks to Leighton for muelling and the Syndicate for chipping in, 05/12/13.
Hazed golden orange with a moderate off white covering.
Nose is bitter citric hops, orange sherbet, grassy notes, mandarin, light pine, grapefruit, pithy citrics.
Taste comprises mango, bitter citrics, orange pith, grapefruit, citric dipped straw, toasty maltness, pine resin.
Medium bodied, fine carbonation, grassy hop bitterness to conclude.
Solid IPA.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text:
Growler 750ml. Thx Tommy.
Pours clear blond with low white head. Intense lacing. Aroma is of tropical fruits, citrus. Taste is of citrus, tropical fruits, somme bitterness. All in finesse. Palate: Light body. Overall: Pretty good. Nice aromatic. Very easily drinkable. A tad light? Outstanding anyways...

UPDATED: APR 2, 2014 Growler cheers to Leighon you mad dog. Pours bright yellow with a thick, white head leaving loads of lacing. Nose is outrageous! Loads of stone and tropical fruit galore - mango, peach, pear, tangerine, citrus peel. Fruit sweetness with an aggressive underlying bitterness and some pepper. Taste is big on peach and mango notes with huge pine. Smooth passionfruit with orange and mandarin on the finish. Plenty juicy and big tropical fruit forward. Pineapple running through the back end. World class fruit bomb

5th December 2013Craft Clerkenwell tasting. Thanks to Leighton for this evenings New England haul. Hazy gold beer with a small white head. Rich skunky hop nose. Palate is slightly soft and dry. A mild fine carbonation. Mild skunky hop with an undertone of minty pine. A little hop spice. Pretty subtle orange and tangerine citrus. Light dry finish with more hop spice.

Tap at the Farmhouse
Pours a hazy golden with a lovely fluffed white head. Juicy kiwi and mango on the nose. A delightful beer to drink, soft and nuanced with a light prickliness on the tongue. Bursting with mango juice, tangerine, and lemon zest. Light herbal presence adds depth. Simple and elegant. Very quenching and never tiresome. I couldnt help but drink a fair amount of this (over Heady Topper and Edward).

Growler to vessel

Light hazy yellow with a solid quilt of whites. Smells of resin, grapefruit, some light malts, a little bit of orange zest. Some bits of peach also in the nose. Flavor is light malts, some sweetness, some grass and pear juice, some interesting chemical character. Really not seeing the appeal others are getting here; seems really simple and not really all that special. Medium on full bodied for the style with fairly hi carb and an off dry finish. Meh.

750ml bomber shared by jsprime. golden with a white head. just a stunning beer all around. the malt body is crisp and clean and supportive but really only there to showcase the hops. the cleanest most insanely drinakble IPA ive ever had. a masterpiece.

Pale hazy straw pour with a thick white head. Incredible aroma with a lot of bright citrus hop aroma a lot of soft flinty bitterness. Minerally and bracing with a bit of lingering kiwi fruit. Damn awesome stuff.

Au nez cest assurément la plus près dune heady topper qui, sans être meilleure, navait pas vraiment de comparatif aromatique. Le corps est rond mais jamais lourd avec une pigmentation tropicale imposante, orange, mangue, ananas, goyave et un côté sapiné bien agrippé au support de céréales pales. Un formidable breuvage.

This brew pours a slightly cloudy yellow-gold color with a thin white head that diminishes quickly to an outer ring. Short strings of lacing on the glass. Aroma of citrus, herbal hops and malt. Medium-bodied with flavors of grassy hops, grapefruit and toasted malt. The finish is moderately bitter with a citrusy hops aftertaste. Solid IPA all around.
Growler, same day. Hazy yellow pour with lacy white head. Dank weed aroma, very hoppy, intense tropical notes. Taste is bitter but not overly so, very oily hops, dank, powerful. Very tasty.

Rating #6500! 750mL thanks to DoctorB2B on BA and Untappd! Pours a beautiful, glowing, full haze peach with thicker buttermilk foam. Good retention and lacing. Nose is fresher nectarine, peach juice, grapefruit. Taste is interesting- different for sure with way more rustic cornmeal and crackery malt than its Hill Farmstead peers. In the finish is more than expected herbal medley with a hint of sugar cube- rosemary, sage, white pepper. No soapiness or harsh bitterness- this is more juicy and complete than many IPAs including top Hill Farmstead offspring. I want to give this a 5 for palate because it really does something amazing like a blend of herbal garden, thick mango juice, blood orange seltzer, and rustic cornmeal and whole grain cracker. Really impressive and bold. Nuanced. Quite a special beer. If you approach this beer as a saison instead of an IPA, I think your mindset will change to really appreciate the soft, special nuances this one has to offer. The soft sourdough cracker, whole cracked wheat, and rustic farm malt backbone blend with refreshing yellow and orange nectar fruits. Aromatic, beautiful nose with Meyer lemon and kumquat liquor matches a herbal garden medley in the taste. Really should be moved to saison in my opinion. But overall, it is nice to have refreshing, soft IPAs and APAs that are blending with the saison style. Tired Hands has the same dilemma. Every successive sip of this beer brings so many memories of the best of APA, IPA, and saison into one. Really a beautiful, moving experience. 8/4/10/5/18=4.5

Growler shared by GT2. Great pour- glowing peach. Good white foam with good retention. Aroma is peach and mango with white pepper. Taste is floral, doughy, orange juice. Dry finish. Mixed herbal medley in taste mixes with some raw, soft farmhouse grain. Works even better as saison methinks. Really fell in love with this beer!
UPDATED: SEP 19, 2013 Growler 750mL. Jaune dorée trouble. Pamplemousse blanc et kumquats, présence très subtile du malt en arrière-plan. Belle présence en bouche, finale sèche. Excellente.

In short: A bright, sharp and refreshing blond IPA with focus on lemongrass and grapefruits.
How: Tap at Parker Pie, West Glover VT.
The look: Cloudy yellow-blond body topped by a persistent small white head leaving lots of lacings on the glass.
In long: The hoppy is extremely bright, very lemony, white grapefruits, lemongrass, flowers. In mouth the beer feels light-body, lighter body than expected for a 6.7% beer. The crispy crackery cereals remain discreet and feels a bit wheaty-dry, sensation of my original plain Shredded Wheat breakfast cereals. Assertive hopping that feels halfway between lemongrass and white grapefruits. Also some watermelon. Very bright and clean. Light tartness-acidity. Refreshing beer. Another rating for me, and people may be laughing at us now but when the economy collapses and money is worth nothing Im certain girls will be attracted to guys with the most beer ratings.

UPDATED: DEC 7, 2013 Growler from the brewery. Pours cloudy, matte gold with a large, frothy white head. Lovely pithy citrus nose, lots of grapefruit and tangerine, hint of hay. Light to medium sweet flavor with plenty of tangerine, grapefruit, peach, melon and canteloupe. Medium bodied with fine, massaging carbonation. Faint resins on the finish, balanced pale malt sweetness, suggestions of the strength, more mildly dried tangerine, grapefruit, hay, stone fruits. Gorgeous. Effortlessly drinkable.(4.3)Growler shared in London. This is the third time Ive had this beer and Im going to bump up the score a bit. Ive had a lot of IPAs in the last few months, and in so doing Im now able to say that this beer really is a few notches above the rest. Nearly flawless. (4.6)

2L Growler. Thanks for sharing, Chas! Massive flint, papaya seed, pineapple skin, and cat aroma. One of those big tropical bomb hop sets that has a real earth edge to it. Flavors clean up the odder edges and this becomes a nicely refined, ultra fresh and drinkable IPA with great flavor. Im impressed by its paleness. Clean, vibrant, electrically hoppy and wonderfully delicious.

2L from Grizelda thanks pours a bright hazy yellow fluffy white head nice lining nose was grapefruit grassy citrus but not over the top taste was a smooth bitter nice fresh green apple not sour tho dam good ipa

Thanks to lookrider on BA for this solid tick. Brilliant clear golden color with a small white head. Very good citrus aroma, a little simcoe-esque, with sweet biscuit malt in the background. The flavor is explosive with sweet malt and extremely well-balanced citrus - orange, grapefruit, and tangerine, as well as some mango and candy corn. Medium-bodied and very resinous with average carbonation. Hell of a good IPA.

Swing-top growler at the parentals, shared with my Dad. Pour is Hazy golden in appearance with a big, pillowy white head and great lacing. Super juicy, grassy, pineappley, grapefruit peel, biscuity, dank, resinous, weedy aroma. Taste is really well-balanced - almost sweet upfront, but the dank/weedy/piney hops come through. The hops are used very nicely, as to not be overpowering - great straw and doughy backbone with some sweet fruits on the backend - mangos, oranges, and pineapple - ending medium bitter. Medium, almost sticky mouthfeel with medium carbonation. Great use of Simcoe, with flavors like a DIPA, though the lower alcohol makes me want to drink this all day.

750mL growler, sent from Glouglouburp (thanks a lot, Dany), pours a very cloudy pale yellow with a small white head. Aroma brings out notes of citrus, lemongrass and some grapefruit - not a whole lot of signature Hill Farmstead on the nose compared to the actual HF IPAs. Flavour is similar, bringing out lots of lemongrass, a little citrus, a little grapefruit, and a thin dry biscuity malt backing. The hops arent that far forward, though there is a noticeable astringency. Palate is quite lemony and dry, leaving a light bitterness on the finish. Solid IPA, but no where near the level of greatness of HFs IPAs.

pours hazy very pale yellow with a nice white head, some retention and lacing. dank and juicy hops, clean and chewy pale malts, citrus-plenty, some bitter herbs and hops oil. average carbonation, medium body - oily, relatively short citrusy lightly piney finish. good balance, good drinkability and very nice mouthfeel. excellent!
Growler. Light golden pour with white head. Light grassy and herbal hop flavors. Nice and light, very drinkable.

750ml growler generously shared by czar.
Appearance : Slightly hazy pale yellow with small foamy head. Some lacing.

Aroma : Juicy citrusy hops with lots of malt. Rather spicy with floral and herbal notes. Fresh leafy hops. Sharp and very aromatic. Light honey notes.

Taste : Sharp piny and leafy hops with malt. Light honey with floral hops. Malty and hoppy finish. Moderate bitterness. Juicy citrusy hops. Slightly oily. A wee bit hot on the finish (because of spicy notes or alcohol is hard to tell).

Palate : Hard to comment on carbonation because its a non counter pressure growler. Nice body while being fairly dry.

Overall : Wow another awesome IPA by Shaun. Really sharp and hoppy. Really aromatic and expressive. Long hoppy aroma persistence on the fininsh. Smooth bitterness.Nice smooth fruitiness all along the flavor profile. Really drinkable. Awesome beer.

Pours a hazy blond with a medium white head.  aroma has stonefruits accented by pine and grapefruit.  Flavor follows suit...nice rindy grapefruit and pine bitterness.  Mouthfeelis medium and resinous with a bitter rindy/grapefruity finish.
Just a fantastic IPA from the folks in Greensboro.  Really crisp fresh citrus and no bitterness.  Just tons of flavor with light balancing sweetness and tons of hoppy goodness.

Light, hazy golden color, thin white head. Cheerful aroma of orange, lemon, mango, and peach. Akin to a single IPA version of Society & Solitude #6. Mild sweetness balanced with a hint of citrus rind bitterness. Clean, crisp, and very refreshing. Little to no alcohol presence.

Hazy golden color with a medium sized, white head that left nice lacing on the glass. Aroma of floral hops, juicy citrus fruits, some pine, toast, and lighter tropical fruits.  Taste of citrus, light pine, some tropical fruits, wheat, light lemon, and a grapefruit bitterness in the finish.

UPDATED: JUN 19, 2013 Sampled at the brewery.   Pours cloudy golden with a lacy white head.  Aroma of citrusy hops and pale/caramel malts.  Flavor a nice blend.  Average texture.  A great IPA. 
Edit: Poured from a growler into a Hill Farmstead glass.  Bright, cloudy, golden like a lot of the beers at this brewery.  Aroma of citrusy hops.  So good.

On tap at Tired Hands. Aroma includes big citrus notes, grapefruit,  mango, and slight funk. Magnificent cloudy lemon meringue with a foamy white head and intense lacing. Taste begins with subtle tart flavor and funk followed by a wave of citrus and passionfruit with palatable hoppy bitterness. Flavors linger after a crisp finish.
Growler fresh fRom brewery, amazingly delicious, juicy and citrusy, loving it!

750 ml growler from PhillyCraft. Thanks Vin! It pours a very pale, hazy yellow color with a good white head. Glad to see this held carbonation over the long trip. The aroma is a bit dank with some light spicy and citrusy hops. Very light malt character, maybe some light pilsner and wheat. The flavor is the same. Bright citrus and spicy hops with some pilsner like quality. A little passionfruit as it warms with a citrus peel like bitterness that creeps in at the very finish. Incredibly smooth, soft mouthfeel. Man, this is tasty stuff. Another winner.

UPDATED: JUN 5, 2013 750ml growler... Pours a golden yellow hay tint, haze throughout, and topped with a creamy white head... Aroma of fresh grass and dank grapefruit notes that runs assertively throughout.  Juicy from an ipa aspect and really delectable. Some mild sweetness throughout... Flavors are more of the same piney juicy grapefruit and citrus. Dank and juicy and juicy. Semi sweet through the middle with a more of that pronounced hoppy character. Just shy of medium bodied with semi-lively carbonation. Really easy clean hoppy drinking.
Growler. Pours super light. Aroma is full of hops. The taste is full of flavor and not overly hoppy.

Had this at the tasting at the hotel in Waterbury on our Vermont trip.  Pours a hazy gold with a thin to medium sized white head.  Smells super musky, little bit of lemon and orange, lots of orange zest, tons of musk.  Medium bodied, musky, little bit of citrus, velvety and smooth.  Really smooth bodied, wheat, lemon, musk, vague hints of coriander into the finish.  Musk, citrus.  Delicious.

Growler pour thanks to Vinny.  Aroma of juicy grapefruit, grass, and lemon.  Pours hazy yellow with great head. Tastes like a perfect pale ale with grassy hop mixed with juicy citrus.  No bitterness for that profile.  Love it.

On tap @ Hill Farmstead. Hazy bright yellow with a medium fully lasting white head and intense lacing. Aroma of dank hops, pine, citrus, tropical fruits... wow! Taste is moderately sweet with pine, citrus, tropical fruits and light to moderate bitterness. Medium body. Dry. The aroma of this IPA is wonnderful. If ithe taste could be a little less sweet, it would probably be my best IPA ever. Dangerously drinkable and refreshing. Homerun from Grassroots here!

On Draft at Worthy Burger! Cloudy dark yellow. Nice lacing
Nose is a hint of dank pine cone, orange zest and bright fruity bitterness
Taste is very nice. Lovely zest from tangerines, grapefruit, very sessionable malt profile, lovely full bitterness of pine and grapefruit. Smooth finish. Insanely drinkable and lovely on a hot summer day.

Tap. Pours cloudy amber with a medium white creamy head that dissipates with decent lacing. Aroma is fruity citrus, pine, lighlty tropical. Light sweet, light bitter flavors, dry finish. Medium body, soft mouthfeel.

UPDATED: AUG 13, 2013 Tap at black back.  Clean bright juicy grapefruit.  Orangepeel.  Awesome tropical fruit provides balance.  No abrasive bitterness.  Great hop integration.  No toffee.  Just big juicy grapefruit pineapple and fresh oranges.  Awesome

Draft at Blackback. Pours a bright yellow color with a finger of sticky foam. On the nose its big hoppy citrus and earth notes. The palate follows the nose nicely with that round smooth mouthfeel that they nail everytime ! Lemon rind, straw,pretty dank hop profile with a nice rolling bitterness through the finish.

On tap at Blackback with Bill. Pours murky yellow gold with medium white head, nice lacing. Aromas of dank hops, well water, lemons, crust, and tree. Taste of tangy dry hops maybe some simcoe or citra with loads of citrus and earthy tones. Medium in body, with a perfect finish. Another knockout from HF.
